title: The Lamb and the Harvest
shortSummary: Revelation 14 presents a vivid vision of the Lamb standing on Mount Zion with 144,000 redeemed followers, the proclamation of the eternal gospel, and the final judgment through the harvest imagery. This chapter emphasizes the faithfulness of God's people, the certainty of divine judgment, and the ultimate victory of Christ over evil.
timeline: c. AD 95 - The Apostle John's Revelation visions on the island of Patmos

keyCharacters.name: The Lamb
keyCharacters.description: Jesus Christ portrayed as the sacrificial Lamb who stands on Mount Zion with His redeemed people, symbolizing victory and authority.

keyCharacters.name: The 144,000
keyCharacters.description: A group of redeemed servants of God, marked by purity and faithfulness, who follow the Lamb wherever He goes and sing a unique song.

keyCharacters.name: Three Angels
keyCharacters.description: Messengers who proclaim the everlasting gospel, announce the fall of Babylon, and warn of the judgment awaiting those who worship the beast.

keyCharacters.name: The Son of Man
keyCharacters.description: Christ depicted sitting on a white cloud with a golden crown and a sharp sickle, symbolizing His role in the final harvest and judgment.

definitions.definition: A biblical term referring to the holy mountain in Jerusalem, symbolizing God's presence and the place of His redeemed people.
A term indicating the initial and special portion of a harvest dedicated to God, symbolizing the redeemed as a consecrated group.
The eternal and unchanging message of salvation through Jesus Christ, proclaimed to all nations.

definitions.term: Winepress of the Wrath of God
definitions.definition: A metaphor for God's righteous judgment and punishment poured out on the wicked at the end of the age.

outline.heading: The Lamb and the 144,000 on Mount Zion
outline.description: John sees the Lamb standing on Mount Zion with 144,000 redeemed servants who are pure, faithful, and blameless before God, singing a new song only they can learn.

outline.heading: The Three Angelic Messages
outline.description: Three angels proclaim the everlasting gospel, announce the fall of Babylon, and warn of the eternal punishment for those who worship the beast and receive his mark, calling for patient endurance among the saints.

outline.heading: The Vision of the Harvest
outline.description: The Son of Man appears on a white cloud with a golden crown and a sharp sickle, commanded by an angel to reap the earthâ€™s harvest, symbolizing the gathering of the righteous.

outline.heading: The Harvest of the Grapes and God's Wrath
outline.description: Two angels with sharp sickles gather the ripe grapes of the earth and cast them into the great winepress of God's wrath, resulting in a vivid depiction of divine judgment.

application: Remain faithful and pure in following Christ, imitating the 144,000 who are blameless and steadfast in their walk with the Lamb.
Proclaim the gospel boldly to all nations, recognizing the urgency as the hour of God's judgment approaches.
Endure patiently through trials by keeping God's commandments and maintaining faith in Jesus, trusting that eternal rest awaits the faithful.
Live with an awareness of the coming judgment, avoiding compromise with worldly systems symbolized by Babylon and the beast.

keyVerses.text: And I looked, and, lo, a Lamb stood on the mount Sion, and with him an hundred forty and four thousand, having his Father's name written in their foreheads.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights the intimate relationship between Christ and His redeemed people, marked by divine ownership and protection.

keyVerses.text: And I saw another angel fly in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach unto them that dwell on the earth, and to every nation, and kindred, and tongue, and people, Saying with a loud voice, Fear God, and give glory to him; for the hour of his judgment is come: and worship him that made heaven, and earth, and the sea, and the fountains of waters.
keyVerses.significance: These verses emphasize the universal call to worship God and the urgency of recognizing His coming judgment.

keyVerses.text: Here is the patience of the saints: here are they that keep the commandments of God, and the faith of Jesus.
keyVerses.significance: This verse encourages believers to persevere in obedience and faith amidst persecution and trials.

keyVerses.text: And the winepress was trodden without the city, and blood came out of the winepress, even unto the horse bridles, by the space of a thousand and six hundred furlongs.
keyVerses.significance: This vivid imagery underscores the severity and extent of God's righteous judgment on the wicked.
